verbs.description: undamn (third-person singular simple present undamns, present participle undamning, simple past and past participle undamned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To undo the damning of; to free from damnation.
examples: At one point he had jestingly called himself a case worker for the potentially damnable. Now it appeared there might be case workers in Hell trying to undamn its souls.
